a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Access to electricity vs. GDP per capita, 2020
Having access to electricity is defined in international statistics as having an electricity source that can provide
very basic lighting, and charge a phone or power a radio for 4 hours per day. GDP per capita is adjusted for
inflation and differences in the cost of living between countries.
Data source: Data compiled from multiple sources by World Bank
Note: GDP per capita is expressed in international-$ at 2017 prices.
